title: Understanding Discontinuation Syndrome
text: Discontinuation syndrome occurs when there is a sudden stop or rapid decrease in the dosage of an antidepressant. It is important to taper off medications gradually to avoid this syndrome.

hintAnswer: $$time-limited$$ syndrome caused by sudden cessation or tapering too quickly off of an antidepressant
title: Identifying Discontinuation Syndrome
text: What is the correct description of discontinuation syndrome?
choices: that dopamine hyperactivity in the brain’s mesolimbic pathway causes the positive symptoms of schizophrenia; that a hypofunction, formed in the early years of neurodevelopment in the NMDA receptors located on glutamatergic neurons is the cause of schizophrenia; hyperfunction (too much activity) at serotonin receptors
drug induced movement disorders, like akathisia, dystonia, tardive dyskinesia, $$pseudo-Parkinson’s$$, and neuroleptic malignant syndrome

potentially $$life-threatening$$ $$drug-drug$$ interaction; caused when high levels of serotonin are built up in the body. Signs and symptoms of serotonin syndrome include agitation, restlessness, insomnia, confusion, muscle rigidity, tachycardia, hypertension, dilated pupils, sweating, diarrhea, shivering, and headache
